Comment:
I chose to annotate this game because i played better in it, in terms of sacrifices and maintaining my agressive stance than in any other game i've played... Although i'll admit i made some mistakes as well .... I'm playing black 
Big thanks to my opponent lethalia for the fun game
not a very agressive second move, i think this negates most of his advantage as white.... a recurrant theme for white in the beginning of this game seems to be defensive moves

the advantage for white of his pawn structure severly limits my dark bishop ... so i offer to trade for his
offer declined.... but in such a way as to prevent a break in his pawn structure
what was i thinking here? if he plays f3, i have to retreat, but the knight on his kingside will only be able to go to e2, perhaps i should have made a more agressive decision
i should have traded bishops before making that last move in order to prevent him from castling and to cause him to waste a move getting his rook back to his back rank.... hindsight is 20 20
